detaileddescription.para: Helper macro for defining status details type enums.

memberdef.name: tiledb_array_schema_evolution_set_timestamp_range

detaileddescription.para: Sets timestamp range in an array schema evolution This function sets the output timestamp of the committed array schema after evolution. The lo and hi values are currently required to be the same or else an error is thrown.

parameterdescription.para: The lower bound of timestamp range.
The upper bound of timestamp range, it must euqal to the lower bound.

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_ERR for error.

detaileddescription.para: Gets timestamp range in an array schema evolution

parameterdescription.para: The lower bound of timestamp range.
The upper bound of timestamp range.

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_ERR for error.

memberdef.name: tiledb_subarray_add_point_ranges

detaileddescription.para: Adds point ranges to the given dimension index of the subarray Effectively add_range(x_i, x_i) for count points in the target array, but set in bulk to amortize expensive steps.

memberdef.argsstring: (tiledb_ctx_t *ctx, tiledb_query_t *query, uint32_t dim_idx, const void *start, uint64_t count) TILEDB_NOEXCEPT
memberdef.name: tiledb_query_add_point_ranges

detaileddescription.para: Adds a set of point ranges along subarray dimension index. Each value in the target array is added as add_range(x,x) for count elements. The datatype of the range components must be the same as the type of the dimension of the array in the query.

parameterdescription.para: The query to add the range to.
The index of the dimension to add the range to.
The start of the ranges array.

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_ERR for error.
The stride is currently unsupported. Use nullptr as the stride argument.

detaileddescription.para: Get the number of relevant fragments from the subarray. Should only be called after size estimation was asked for.

parameterdescription.para: The query to get the data fron.
Variable to receive the number of relevant fragments.

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_ERR for error.
Should only be called after size estimation was run.

detaileddescription.para: Get extended query status details.

The contained enumeration tiledb_query_status_details_reason_t indicates extended information about a returned query status in order to allow improved client-side handling of buffers and potential resubmissions.

parameterdescription.para: The query from which to retrieve status details.

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_ERR for error.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a TileDB context, which contains the TileDB storage manager that manages everything in the TileDB library. This is a provisional API which returns an error object when the context creation fails. This API will be replaced with a more proper "v2" of context alloc in the near future. The main goal is to use to this to capture potential failures to inform the v2 alloc design.
Without config (i.e., use default configuration):
With some config:

parameterdescription.para: The TileDB context to be created.
Error object returned upon error (NULL if there is no error).

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_OOM or TILEDB_ERR for error.

memberdef.argsstring: (tiledb_ctx_t *ctx, const char *array_uri, const char **fragment_uris, const uint64_t num_fragments, tiledb_config_t *config) TILEDB_NOEXCEPT
memberdef.name: tiledb_array_consolidate_fragments

detaileddescription.para: Consolidates the given fragment URIs into a single fragment.

Note: This API needs to be used with caution until we implement consolidation with timestamps. For now, if the non-empty domain of the consolidated fragments overlap anything in the fragments that come in between, this could lead to unpredictable behavior.

parameterdescription.para: The name of the TileDB array whose metadata will be consolidated.
URIs of the fragments to consolidate.
Configuration parameters for the consolidation (nullptr means default, which will use the config from ctx).

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK on success, and TILEDB_ERR on error.

parameterdescription.para: The TileDB array schema to be created

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_ERR for error.

detaileddescription.para: Get the string representation of a mime type enum

detaileddescription.para: Turn a string mime type into a TileDB enum

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_ERR for error.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves the number of cells written to the fragments by the user.
Contributions from each fragment to the total are as described in following.
In the case of sparse fragments, this is the number of non-empty cells in the fragment.

In the case of dense fragments, TileDB may add fill values to populate partially populated tiles. Those fill values are counted in the returned number of cells. In other words, the cell number is derived from the number of integral tiles written in the file.

note: The count returned is the cumulative total of cells written to all fragments in the current fragment_info entity, i.e. count may effectively include multiples for any cells that may be overlapping across the various fragments.

parameterdescription.para: The number of cells to be retrieved.

simplesect.para: TILEDB_OK for success and TILEDB_ERR for error.
